div.div: Detailed description of modelled derived indicators with acronyms, definitions and references.

tr.td: Index calculated at community level as the sum of the biomass only for those groups fitted to time series data (Unit: t/km 2) 89. The Cm biomasses assessed were: Forage fish (European pilchard and European anchovy); Demersal fish (European hake, medium and small demersals); Sharks and rays (sharks, rays/skates); and Invertebrates (benthic and benthopelagic cephalopods, crustaceans and benthos).

Expresses biomass species diversity by considering those organisms with trophic levels 3 or higher 90 91. The Kempton index is calculated as follow 91:
where Fg is the total number of functional groups in the model, R 1 and R 2 are the representative biomass values of the 10th and 90th percentiles in the cumulative abundance distribution.

TL of the modelled community spans the whole ecosystem (living groups) 92 including all functional groups (fitted and not fitted). TLs are calculated as follow 16:
where j is the predator of prey i, DC ji is the fraction of prey i in the diet of each predator j, and TL i is the TL of prey i. The mean trophic level of community is calculated as follow 10:
where B MT is total biomass of the modeled ecosystem, B Mi is the biomass of each species i in the model, and TL i is the trophic level of species i as an output of the model (note: B Mi, DC ji and TL i vary in time).
Mean trophic level of groups with TL >3.25
Calculated as the mTLco but including all functional groups (fitted and not fitted), excluding only marine mammals, seabirds and sea turtles mTL3.25 93;

TL of the catch for all retained species. Retained species are species caught in fishing operations, although not necessarily targeted by a fishery and which are retained because they are of commercial interest (i.e. not discarded) 92. Trophic level of the catch is calculated as follow 10:
where Y L is total landings, Y i is the landing of species i and TL i is the trophic level of species i (note: Y L, Y i and TL i vary in time).
